title: Dooagh Loop Walk Route

images.title: David Quinn / View of Dooagh and Croaghaun
images.caption: View of Dooagh and Croaghaun. The road west of Dooagh traverses Croghaun Mountain and leads to Keem Strand, offering panoramic views of Clew Bay. A detour off the Keem Road takes you to Lough Acorrymore, surrounded by scree slopes and now serving as a reservoir for the entire island. Croghaun's coastal side boasts towering cliffs, the highest on the island.

images.title: A.-K. D., CC0, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dooagh Trail marker. Along the road from Dooagh beach to Lough Corrymore stands Corrymore House, once the residence of Captain Charles Boycott, a British land agent whose ostracism by his local community in Ireland in 1880 sparked the term "boycott" in the English language. Captain Boycott relocated to Corrymore House after his home in Keem was destroyed by fire. Renowned American artist Robert Henri also resided there for a period, having purchased the house in 1924.

images.title: A.-K. D., CC0, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Panoramic shot in the first third of the Dooagh Trail with the Owenavally/ Abha na Bhaile to the left.

images.title: A.-K. D., CC0, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dooagh Trail picnic bench

images.title: A.-K. D., CC0, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Owenavally stream/ Abha na Bhaile along the Dooagh trail on Achill Island

images.title: A.-K. D., CC0, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ruined cottage Dooagh trail

images.title: Eugene O'Loughlin @eoloughlin as outlined on source page, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Don Allum plaque, Achill Island. In the heart of Dooagh stands a monument commemorating Don Allum, the ocean rower who achieved the remarkable feat of being the first to row across the Atlantic in both directions, culminating in his arrival at Dooagh village.

images.title: Robert Henri , Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Road to Corrymore by Henri. Robert Henri (1865–1929), an American artist who came to Achill regularly in the early 20th century. During his early trips to Achill he painted extensively and is reputed to have completed portraits of most of the children in Dooagh village. He bought Corrymore House on the hill above Dooagh in 1924.

description: This circular walk explores the area around the village of Dooagh on Achill Island in County Mayo. The waymarked trail runs for about 4.5km with some wonderful views over the beautiful Keem Bay, the Dingle peninsula and the surrounding Achill mountains and countryside. You can continue your walking around the island by heading east to the Valley Loop Walk. There's also the beautiful beach at the horseshoe-shaped Keem Bay and the wonderful viewpoint at Minaun Heights .
display_address: R319, Slievemore ED, Westport-Belmullet Municipal District, County Mayo, Connacht, F28 X018, Éire / Ireland
